phases.name: Foundation
phases.description: Lay the groundwork. Fiscal sponsorship, licensing inquiry, venue visits, the Equity call. Plant seeds, see shows, meet people.

phases.name: The Reading
phases.description: Cast the reading, rehearse, execute. Our debut in Chicago. The impression we make here is the foundation of everything.

phases.name: Building the Organization
phases.description: 501(c)(3) incorporation. Board installation. Founding Circle fundraising. The machine begins to run.

phases.name: The Production
phases.description: Rehearsals, tech, previews, opening night. The lights go down in a Chicago storefront. Not our last.

milestones.title: Read the play together
milestones.description: Cassie reads in NM, then read and discuss together at home

milestones.title: Call AEA Central Regional Office
milestones.description: Resolve Cassie’s member-producer status — 312-641-0393

milestones.title: Apply for Fractured Atlas fiscal sponsorship
milestones.description: $129/year membership, 8% admin fee, approval in ~2 weeks

milestones.title: Send licensing inquiry to Concord Theatricals
milestones.description: Confirm availability, royalty rates, and any illusion design requirements

milestones.title: Start the Dream Doc
milestones.description: Seed the shared Google Doc after the first real conversation about the play

milestones.title: People Map evening
milestones.description: Wine, a shared screen, “OK who do we know?” — fill in the Google Sheet together

milestones.title: Visit Theatre Wit, Bramble, and The Den as audience
milestones.description: See shows at all three target venues within 60 days

milestones.title: Join League of Chicago Theatres
milestones.description: $150/year for budget under $25K — ChicagoPlays listing, Hot Tix, mixers

milestones.title: Choose company name
milestones.description: Secure domain and social media handles once decided

milestones.title: Reach out to SLC network
milestones.description: Jerry Rapier, Shannon Musgrave, former collaborators — plant seeds

milestones.title: Identify and approach a director
milestones.description: Someone with Chicago credibility who understands intimate, rigorous work

milestones.title: Cast the reading
milestones.description: 4 actors — first opportunity to build Chicago relationships

milestones.title: Secure venue for the reading
milestones.description: Intimate space, invited audience only — 29-Hour Code restrictions apply

milestones.title: Register reading with AEA
milestones.description: 29-Hour Staged Reading Code — max 29 hours over 14 days, max 3 presentations

milestones.title: Execute the reading
milestones.description: Our debut in Chicago. Host reception, collect contacts, make the impression count.

milestones.title: Incorporate as Illinois 501(c)(3)
milestones.description: IL Form NFP 102.10 ($50) + IRS Form 1023-EZ ($275)

milestones.title: Recruit and install board of directors
milestones.description: Minimum 3 members — begin identifying candidates during Foundation phase

milestones.title: Launch Founding Circle fundraising
milestones.description: 10-20 individuals at $250–$1,000 each — investment, not charity

milestones.title: Secure production license from Concord
milestones.description: Full production license for The Thin Place — professional rate applies

milestones.title: Opening night
milestones.description: The lights go down in a Chicago storefront. Four actors. One play. Not our last.
